description: Object description: Sharpless 2-86 is an emission nebula located near the star Albireo in Cygnus. It is illuminated by the energy from the cluster of bright young blue stars, NGC 6823, in the center of the picture. Open star cluster NGC 6823 is 50 light years across and lies 6000 light years away. The age of the cluster is about two million years. The huge pillars and dark globules of gas and dust pointing towards the open cluster in the centre are shaped by erosion from hot radiation emitted from the brightest cluster stars. NGC 6820 is the small reflection nebula in the lower right of the picture. Image Aquisition This is a composite of Ha and R-G-B frames with a total integration time of 44 hours imaged on 15 different nights between 2015 and 2020 from my rooftop terrace in the Vienna city centre. Cameras used were AtikONE and ZWO ASI1600m mounted on a Skywatcher/Lacerta 200/800mm Newton, Takahashi Epsilon 130/430mm and Skywatcher Newton 130/650mm. Total Exposure : 44,2 hours R-G-B: 630 x 60s (total 10,5h) Ha: 569 x 213s (total 33,7h) Imaging dates (15 indivudual nights): 02-06/11/2015 08/09/2016 14/09/2016 12/06/2017 22/07/2017 29/07/2017 28/09/2017 16/08/2018 17/08/2018 20/08/2020 21/08/2020 Larger FOV (430mm FL)
title: Sharpless 2-86 / NGC 6823
